column4: so in 11.10 with unity, how do I make alt-tab or an equivalent respect workspaces like it used to. I want to have more than one "set" of applications open at a time?
What do you mean?  (Alt-Tab switches windows not work-spaces)
it used to switch between windows in a workspace, now it switches between windows in all workspaces.
Far as I know, it always did that.
I like my workspaces segregated because I'll have say eclipse and ff open in 3 different workspaces but one is for web dev, one for c++, and one for reading the nets
nope.
I've got 11.04 running classic desktop on my desktop and it behaves as I said, my laptop has 11.10 and it has the current behavior (which sucks for me)
I see that you are correct.  In gnome2 Alt-Tab would only switch between windows in one workspace.
I guess that's not the way it works in Unity.
so is there a good way to re-enable that. I like the search overlay of unity like win 7, but I don't want to shut down all non-task related firefoxes
I'm not sure.  Maybe someone else knows how it can be done.
guess I'll ask again then
Here is a discussion about the use of Alt-Tab in Unity: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1720998
yeah, I tried that. didn't work that well. I'll try again but it still seems pretty broken. Why are workspaces even there if this is how it's going to work?
Was just checking and xfce confines Alt-Tab to windows in current workspace too.
urg, that's great and all but I actually like a lot of what unity does like the search to launch. it saves a lot of space. Why can't it just allow easy return to the previous behavior?
What is "search to launch"?
super key, type fire, enter
I think that is just a hot-key assignment. Right?
.... same as Alt-F2  ?
not sure. reading
yeah alt-f2 is search to me :)
